function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application shows the checkout page after entering details for 'John Doe' in the Customer section including an email, the Address section partially filled with 'United States' as the country, '123 Galaxy Way' as the street address, and 'New York' as the city. Yet, the state and zip code fields are empty. The Payment section offers options between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal. Two items are displayed in the cart - Galaxy S10 5G and Galaxy S10+, with their quantities, prices, and an option to remove each. The cart's total is also shown. A submit button is available for completing the transaction.","explanation":"To continue testing the functionality of the Address section, fill out the 'State' field with a value.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rv:","keys":"NY"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.

Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases. Here is the filtered HTML source code of the web application: 'omitted'.

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page is currently displayed, showing a form divided into 'Customer', 'Address', and 'Payment' sections. The 'Customer' section has fields for first name (already filled with 'John'), last name, and email. The 'Address' section awaits inputs for country, street address, city, state, and zip code. In the 'Payment' section, users can choose between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal. A submit button is available to complete the transaction.","explanation":"Continue filling out the checkout form by completing the 'Last Name' field.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rq:","keys":"Doe"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page shows a detailed form for completing a purchase, with fields for Customer information (first name 'John', last name 'Doe'), Address, and Payment Method. The Address section awaits inputs for country, street address, city, state, and zip code. Users can choose between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal for payment.","explanation":"Proceed by filling in the email address in the Customer section to complete that part of the form.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rr:","keys":"johndoe@example.com"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The checkout page now has customer information fully filled - first name (John), last name (Doe), and email (johndoe@example.com). The address section requests inputs for country, street address, city, state, and zip code. A payment method selector offers options between Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal. A 'Submit' button is available for final transaction confirmation.","explanation":"Continue with filling out the address information by providing a country.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rs:","keys":"United States"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application's checkout page now includes filled-out customer information (John Doe, johndoe@example.com) and partial address information with 'United States' as the country. There are still empty fields for street address, city, state, and zip code in the Address section. Options for payment method include Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal. The form submission button is present for completing the transaction.","explanation":"Next, let's complete the Address section by providing a street address.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rt:","keys":"123 Galaxy Way"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"After entering the customer information and the street address as '123 Galaxy Way,' we are now on the checkout page, which contains partially completed forms for Customer, Address, and Payment. The Customer section has 'John Doe' and 'johndoe@example.com' filled in. The Address section has 'United States' for the country, '123 Galaxy Way' for the street address, but city, state, and zip code are still empty. The Payment section offers Invoice, Credit Card, or PayPal choices. There is also a cart summary showing a total of $1,723.98 featuring two items: Galaxy S10 5G and Galaxy S10+.","explanation":"Proceed by entering the city in the Address section of the form.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":ru:","keys":"New York"}}

Start by describing the website supplied by the user. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then explain what should be achieved with the next action. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :ri:, :r1:, :r2:, :rj:, :rk:, :rl:, :rm:, :rn:, :ro:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:, :rt:, :ru:, :rv:, :r10:. Only use the clear action with clearable elements. The clearable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:, :rt:, :ru:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

explanation.description: Explanation of what should be achieved with the next action

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

anyOf.description: resets the contents of an html element
